title: ASN To Build 1 Million Affordable Houses
text:
13 August 2015 16:28 CET ASN To Build 1 Million Affordable Houses By Daily Guide 
ASN Constructions, a subsidiary of ASN Holdings, has indicated its resolve to construct one million houses within a 10-year period to address the country's housing deficit. 
Prince Sarpong, Group Chief Executive Officer (CEO), ASN Holdings, speaking to the media recently during a tour site, said his outfit has constructed a number of housing units which are ready for acquisition by the public. 
'GRA has signed a partnership with ASN Construction for about 7,000 houses for its staff and the Ghana Cocoa Board (COCOBOD) has also requested for about 2,000 houses,' he said. 
Johannes Akuffo Okutu, the Managing Director, ASN Financial Services Limited, said the Fund offered potential homeowners the opportunity to make monthly contributions over a period of one to five years towards the attainment of 20 percent of the cost of the building. 
He said ASN Financial Services would complete the payment with an affordable mortgage facility. 
Mr Okutu said in the first of the acquisition, the company would provide free life insurance and mortgage protection. 
'Home Investment Fund (HIF) home acquisition attracts no hidden charges in the form of facility fees, search fee and closing fee,' he added. 
According to Dr Mark Nii Akwei Ankrah, former Managing Director of the State Housing Corporation, Ghana needs an effective public-private partnership to resolve its national housing deficit. 
Dr Ankrah said collaboration between government and the private sector would help evolve solutions to tackle the housing challenges. 
The HIF is to facilitate easy public home acquisition, as well as help the individual to save for affordable home ownership and mortgage repayment. 
He commended the management of ASN Financial Services Limited for its foresight in providing solutions to tackle the housing deficit. 
A business desk report
